note: Sloping pointed majuscule | Contrast between thick and thin strokes; presence of serifs at the ends of thin strokes; the vertical strokes of 'rho', 'ypsilon', 'phi' end with a curve to the left; 'beta' is maximized and has round curves; the oblique strokes of kappa are detached from the vertical stroke; the central strokes of mu are merged into a curve; omega has rounded curves; angle of inclination ca. 118°

note.value: The UTOs of Ps. Marcarius/Symeon, Epistula magna (ff. 171, 172, 176, 177, 181, 182) and Ephraem Syrus, Sermo asceticus (ff. 173, 174, 175, 178, 179, 180) were copied by the same scribe and were part of the same original codex
